div.bibl: Dziennik Zwiazkowy, August 7, 1911. THE LAW IS AFTER UNION SLUGGERS(Editorial)

body.p: At last the law is after the notorious labor union sluggers who having gained the confidence of organized labor, spread terror and anarchy in the ranks of workingmen, and become the traitors, than the friends of organized labor. The jury, which has by the state's attorney and by the attorney has found four of them guilty of criminal attacks and organizations. These have occurred quite the city still ineffectually enforced, which will eventually curb these outrages, when public opinion will be stirred. This opinion was strained even Among the workingmen themselves, who did not want the sluggers to enjoy themselves at the expense of the workingmen's ideals; for the just plain outlaws not having anything to do with read work.

Organized labor is a great thing, it is a battering ram crushing the walls of
capitalism. Most people sympathize with the intelligent organized working man, but they detest gangsters.

With whom did these sluggers pretending to be friends of the workingmen, fight? Did they fight against the capitalists? Did they demand shorter hours and higher wages for the working; class? Did they try to eliminate abuses which cause harm to workingmen employed in factories and other places? Not at all. They were settling their personal grievances at the expense of the workingmen, and, like thugs, were attacking workingmen who refused to be dominated by them.

There are many labor unions in Chicago, belonging to the same organization and yet fighting one another. Each of these unions has a leader who has nothing to do with real work. These leaders live at the expense of the workingmen; they oppose one another furiously and quite often fight bloody battles. If these leaders were fighting only among themselves, if they would perforate with bullets, and stab with knives, only their own bodies, it would not be so bad; but alas, these cowards also attack the workingmen of
other unions, and then they run away in an automobile. These outrages were so terrible that the law stepped in and will undoubtedly punish them. It is high time for stopping such for even the lives of workingmen belonging to the labor not safe.
